alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:35PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM TUESDAY TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches locally up to 15 inches benches. * WHERE...In Utah, Tooele and Rush Valleys, Northern Wasatch Front, Salt Lake Valley and Utah Valley. In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...From 5 PM Tuesday to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. Traction laws may be enacted. Heavy snow may impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Blowing and drifting snow will reduce visibility across Uinta County, WY. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation may initially start as a rain-snow mix before rapidly transitioning to all snow as a strong cold front moves through the region. Conditions may deteriorate quickly through the Tuesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
